description:
**Fix Overview**:

To mitigate the Microsoft MSHTML platform spoofing vulnerability (CVE-2024-43461), it is essential to apply the provided security updates to all affected systems:

1. Identify the version of Windows you are operating.
2. Download the necessary updates related to your Windows build from the Microsoft Update Catalog:
   - For Windows 11 Version 24H2: [KB5043080](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5043080)
   - For Windows 11 Version 23H2: [KB5043076](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5043076)
   - For Windows 10 Version 22H2: [KB5043064](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5043064)
   - For Windows 10 Version 21H2: [KB5043067](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5043067)
   - General Windows 10 update: [KB5043083](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5043083)
3. Install the updates and restart your systems as necessary to apply the changes effectively.

**Details**:
- These updates address the spoofing vulnerability that stems from user interface (UI) misrepresentation, which could lead to significant security threats if left unpatched.
- Ensure administrative privileges are available during installation.
- Backup critical data before proceeding with the update installation.
